alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 04 at 6:29AM PDT until May 07 at 8:55AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Washington, including the following counties, Chelan and Okanogan. * WHEN...From 5 PM PDT this afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Area rivers, creeks, and small streams are on the rise due to melting snow from the unseasonably warm weather and heavy rain on snowmelt will exasperate runoff. Flash flooding and debris flows will be possible with steep terrain and locations near burn scars especially susceptible to flash flooding impacts. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Wet slow moving thunderstorms will track across north-central Washington this evening with heavy rain at times continuing through the day Friday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
